value.halfverse: you of high degree and low, rich and poor together.
value.verse:
Hear this, all you peoples;
hearken, all you who dwell in the world, *
My mouth shall speak of wisdom, *
value.halfverse: and my heart shall meditate on understanding.
and set forth my riddle upon the harp.
value.verse: I will incline my ear to a proverb *
Why should I be afraid in evil days, *
value.halfverse: when the wickedness of those at my heels surrounds me,
and boast of their great riches?
value.verse: The wickedness of those who put their trust in their goods, *

value.halfverse: or deliver to God the price of our life;
value.verse: We can never ransom ourselves, *
For the ransom of our life is so great, *
value.halfverse: that we should never have enough to pay it,

value.verse: In order to live for ever and ever, *
value.halfverse: and never see the grave.
and leave their wealth to those who come after them.
value.verse:
For we see that the wise die also;
like the dull and stupid they perish *

Their graves shall be their homes for ever,
their dwelling places from generation to generation, *
value.halfverse: though they call the lands after their own names.

value.verse: Even though honored, they cannot live for ever; *
value.halfverse: they are like the beasts that perish.

value.verse: Such is the way of those who foolishly trust in themselves, *
value.halfverse: and the end of those who delight in their own words.
they go down straightway to the grave.
value.verse:
Like a flock of sheep they are destined to die;
Death is their shepherd; *

value.halfverse: and the land of the dead shall be their home.
value.verse: Their form shall waste away, *

value.halfverse: he will snatch me from the grasp of death.
value.verse: But God will ransom my life; *

value.halfverse: or when the grandeur of their house increases;
value.verse: Do not be envious when some become rich, *

value.halfverse: nor will their grandeur follow them.
value.verse: For they will carry nothing away at their death, *

value.halfverse: and were praised for their success,
value.verse: Though they thought highly of themselves while they lived, *
They shall join the company of their forebears, *
value.halfverse: who will never see the light again.

value.verse: Those who are honored, but have no understanding, *
value.halfverse: are like the beasts that perish.
